004package kut;
005
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007import java.util.Arrays;
008import java.util.Collections;
009import java.util.function.Predicate;
010import java.util.function.BiPredicate;
011import java.util.function.Consumer;
012import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
013import java.util.function.Function;
014import java.util.function.BiFunction;
015
016/** ArrayList utilities */
017public class Arr {
018  Arr () {};
019
020  /**
021   * Returns 'true' if every element of 'a' returns 'true' with 'f'.
022   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
023   * @param a Array.
024   * @param f Function to test elements of 'a'.
025   * @return 'true' if every element of 'a' returns 'true' with 'f'.
026   */
027  public static <T> boolean all (ArrayList<T> a, Predicate<T> f) {
028    for (T e : a) if (!f.test(e)) return false;
029    return true;
030  }
031
032  /**
033   * Returns 'true' if at least an element of 'a' returns 'true' with 'f'.
034   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
035   * @param a Array.
036   * @param f Function to test elements of 'a'.
037   * @return 'true' if at least an element of 'a' returns 'true' with 'f'.
038   */
039  public static <T> boolean any (ArrayList<T> a, Predicate<T> f) {
040    for (T e : a) if (f.test(e)) return true;
041    return false;
042  }
043
044  /**
045   * Returns a new array adding elements of a2 after elements of a1.
046   * @param <T> Tye of array elements.
047   * @param a1 One array.
048   * @param a2 Another array.
049   * @return A new array adding elements of a2 after elements of a1.
050   */
051  public static <T> ArrayList<T> concat (ArrayList<T> a1, ArrayList<T> a2) {
052    ArrayList<T> r = copy(a1);
053    r.addAll(a2);
054    return r;
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * Returns a shallow copy of 'a'.
059   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
060   * @param a Array.
061   * @return A shallow copy of 'a'.
062   */
063  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
064  public static <T> ArrayList<T> copy (ArrayList<T> a) {
065    return (ArrayList<T>) a.clone();
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * Returns a new array with elements resting after removing those ones returned
070   *    by 'take'.
071   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
072   * @param a Array.
073   * @param n Elements counter.
074   * @return A new array with elements resting after removing those ones returned
075   *    by 'take'.
076   */
077  public static <T> ArrayList<T> drop (ArrayList<T> a, int n) {
078    if (n <= 0) return copy(a);
079    ArrayList<T> r = new ArrayList<>();
080    for (int i = n; i < a.size(); ++i) r.add(a.get(i));
081    return r;
082  }
083
084  /**
085   * Returns a new array with elements resting after removing those ones returned
086   *    by 'takeWhile'.
087   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
088   * @param a Array.
089   * @param f Function to test elements of 'a'.
090   * @return A new array with elements resting after removing those ones returned
091   *    by 'takeWhile'.
092   */
093  public static <T> ArrayList<T> dropWhile (ArrayList<T> a, Predicate<T> f) {
094    int sz = a.size();
095    int n = 0;
096    while (n < sz && f.test(a.get(n))) ++n;
097    ArrayList<T> r = new ArrayList<>();
098    for (int i = n; i < sz; ++i) r.add(a.get(i));
099    return r;
100  }
101
102  /**
103   * Returns two arrays:<ul>
104   *   <li>The first, with elements of 'A' without duplicates.
105   *   <li>The second, with duplicates of 'A'. There is only one copy of each duplicate.
106   * </ul>
107   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
108   * @param a Array to split.
109   * @param f: Function 'equals to". (e.g. (e1, e2) -> e1.equals(e2);)
110   * @return Tuple.
111   */
112  public static <T> Tp<ArrayList<T>, ArrayList<T>> duplicates (
113    ArrayList<T> a, BiPredicate<T, T> f
114  ) {
115    ArrayList<T> newA = new ArrayList<>();
116    ArrayList<T> dup = new ArrayList<>();
117    for (T e : a) {
118      if (any(newA, (ne) -> f.test(e, ne))) {
119        if (!any(dup, (ne) -> f.test(e, ne))) dup.add(e);
120      } else {
121        newA.add(e);
122      }
123    }
124    return new Tp<>(newA, dup);
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Executes 'f' with each element of 'a'
129   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
130   * @param a Array.
131   * @param f Function to apply.
132   */
133  public static <T> void each (ArrayList<T> a, Consumer<T>f) {
134    for (T e : a) f.accept(e);
135  }
136
137  /**
138   * Executes 'f' with each element of 'a' and its index.
139   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
140   * @param a Array.
141   * @param f Function to apply.
142   */
143  public static <T> void each (ArrayList<T> a, BiConsumer<T, Integer>f) {
144    for (int i = 0; i < a.size(); ++i) f.accept(a.get(i), i);
145  }
146
147  /**
148   * Returns 'true' if 'a1' and 'a2' have the same elments in the same order.
149   * @param <T> Type of 'a1' and 'a2' elements.
150   * @param a1 Array.
151   * @param a2 Array.
152   * @param f Equals function.
153   * @return 'true' if 'a1' and 'a2' have the same elments in the same order.
154   */
155  public static <T> boolean eq (
156    ArrayList<T> a1, ArrayList<T> a2, BiPredicate<T, T> f
157  ) {
158    int sz = a1.size();
159    if (sz != a2.size()) return false;
160    for (int i = 0; i < sz; ++i)
161      if (!f.test(a1.get(i), a2.get(i))) return false;
162    return true;
163  }
164
165  /**
166   * Returns a fresh array with the elements wich produce 'true' with 'filter'.
167   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
168   * @param a Array to filter.
169   * @param f Filter to apply.
170   * @return A fresh array.
171   */
172  public static <T> ArrayList<T> filter (ArrayList<T> a, Predicate<T> f) {
173    ArrayList<T> r = new ArrayList<>();
174    for (T e : a) if (f.test(e)) r.add(e);
175    return r;
176  }
177
178  /**
179   * Retains the elements wich produce 'true' with 'filter'.
180   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
181   * @param a Array to filter.
182   * @param filter Filter to apply.
183   */
184  public static <T> void filterIn (ArrayList<T> a, Predicate<T> filter) {
185    a.removeIf(filter.negate());
186  }
187
188  /**
189   * Returns the first element of 'a' such that 'f(e)' is 'true' or None if
190   * it is not found.
191   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
192   * @param a Array to filter.
193   * @param f Function to test.
194   * @return Option.
195   */
196  public static <T> Opt<T> find (ArrayList<T> a, Predicate<T> f) {
197    for (T e : a) if (f.test(e)) return Opt.some(e);
198    return Opt.none();
199  }
200
201  /**
202   * Returns the Array 'JSONized' in 'js'.
203   * @param <T> Type of Array elements.
204   * @param js Array 'JSONized'.
205   * @param eFromJs Function to restore elements of the Array 'JSONized' in 'js'.
206   * @return The Array 'JSONized" in 'js'.
207   */
208  public static <T> ArrayList<T> fromJs (
209    String js, Function<String, T> eFromJs
210  ) {
211    return map(Js.ra(js), eFromJs);
212  }
213
214  /**
215   * Returns the index of the first element of 'a' such that 'f(e)' is 'true' or
216   * -1 if it is not found.
217   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
218   * @param a Array to filter.
219   * @param f Function to test.
220   * @return Index.
221   */
222  public static <T> int index (ArrayList<T> a, Predicate<T> f) {
223    for (int i = 0; i < a.size(); ++i) if (f.test(a.get(i))) return i;
224    return -1;
225  }
226
227  /**
228   * Joins an array with 'sep'.
229   * @param a Array.
230   * @param sep Separator.
231   * @return A String.
232   */
233  public static String join (ArrayList<String> a, String sep) {
234    return String.join(sep, a);
235  }
236
237  /**
238   * Creates an Array with 'es' as elements.
239   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
240   * @param es Elements to pack.
241   * @return ArrayList.
242   */
243  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
244  public static <T> ArrayList<T> mk (T... es) {
245    return new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(es));
246  }
247
248  /**
249   * Creates an Array with 'es' as elements.
250   * @param es Elements to pack.
251   * @return ArrayList.
252   */
253  public static ArrayList<Double> mk (double[] es) {
254    ArrayList<Double> r = new ArrayList<>();
255    for (double e : es) r.add(e);
256    return r;
257  }
258
259  /**
260   * Creates an Array with 'es' as elements.
261   * @param es Elements to pack.
262   * @return ArrayList.
263   */
264  public static ArrayList<Integer> mk (int[] es) {
265    ArrayList<Integer> r = new ArrayList<>();
266    for (int e : es) r.add(e);
267    return r;
268  }
269
270  /**
271   * Returns a new array after applying 'f' to each element of 'a'.
272   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
273   * @param <R> Type of 'f' results.
274   * @param a Intial array.
275   * @param f Function to apply.
276   * @return A fresh array.
277   */
278  public static <T, R> ArrayList<R> map (ArrayList<T> a, Function<T, R> f) {
279    ArrayList<R> r = new ArrayList<>();
280    for (T e : a) r.add(f.apply(e));
281    return r;
282  }
283
284  /**
285   * Returns the last element of 'a'.
286   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
287   * @param a Array.
288   * @return The last element of 'a'.
289   * @throws IllegalStateException if array is empty.
290   */
291  public static <T> T peek (ArrayList<T> a) {
292    int ix = a.size() - 1;
293    if (ix == -1) throw new IllegalStateException("Array is empty");
294    return a.get(ix);
295  }
296
297  /**
298   * Returns and remove the last element of 'a'.
299   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
300   * @param a Array.
301   * @return The last element of 'a'.
302   * @throws IllegalStateException if array is empty.
303   */
304  public static <T> T pop (ArrayList<T> a) {
305    int ix = a.size() - 1;
306    if (ix == -1) throw new IllegalStateException("Array is empty");
307    return a.remove(ix);
308  }
309
310  /**
311   * Returns the result of apply 'f' for each element of 'a'.
312   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
313   * @param <R> Type of seed and 'f' results.
314   * @param a Array.
315   * @param seed First value to 'f'.
316   * @param f Function to apply succesively to '(seed, element)'.
317   * @return The result of apply 'f' for each element of 'a'.
318   */
319  public static <T, R> R reduce (ArrayList<T> a, R seed, BiFunction<R, T, R> f) {
320    for (T e : a) seed = f.apply(seed, e);
321    return seed;
322  }
323
324  /**
325   * Returns a new array with elements of 'a' reversed.
326   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
327   * @param a Array.
328   * @return A new array with elements of 'a' reversed.
329   */
330  public static <T> ArrayList<T> reverse (ArrayList<T> a) {
331    ArrayList<T> r = new ArrayList<>();
332    for (int i = a.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) r.add(a.get(i));
333    return r;
334  }
335
336  /**
337   * Reverses elements of 'a'.
338   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
339   * @param a Array.
340   */
341  public static <T> void reverseIn (ArrayList<T> a) {
342    Collections.reverse(a);
343  }
344
345  /**
346   * Resets randomly elements of 'a'.
347   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
348   * @param a Array.
349   */
350  public static <T> void shuffle (ArrayList<T> a) {
351    Collections.shuffle(a);
352  }
353
354  /**
355   * Sort elements of 'a' in mode ascending.<p>
356   * For sorting in descending mode you can use a function 'less' which
357   * returns a 'greater' value. (e.g. (n1, n2) -> n1 > n2)
358   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
359   * @param a Array.
360   * @param less Function. 'less(a, b) returns 'true' if 'a &lt; b'.
361   */
362  public static <T> void sort (ArrayList<T> a, BiPredicate<T, T> less) {
363    Collections.sort(a, (a1, a2) ->
364      less.test(a1, a2)
365      ? -1
366      : less.test(a2, a1)
367        ? 1
368        : 0
369    );
370  }
371
372  /**
373   * Returns a new array with the first 'n' elements of 'a'
374   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
375   * @param a Array.
376   * @param n Elements counter.
377   * @return A new array with the first 'n' elements of 'a'.<ul>
378   *    <li>if n &lt; 0, the new array is empty.
379   *    <li>If n >= a.size(), the new array is equals to 'a'.
380   * </ul>
381   */
382  public static <T> ArrayList<T> take (ArrayList<T> a, int n) {
383    if (n >= a.size()) return copy(a);
384    ArrayList<T> r = new ArrayList<>();
385    for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) r.add(a.get(i));
386    return r;
387  }
388
389  /**
390   * Returns a new array with elements of 'a' while f returns true.
391   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
392   * @param a Array.
393   * @param f Function to test elements of 'a'.
394   * @return A new array with elements of 'a' while f returns true.
395   */
396  public static <T> ArrayList<T> takeWhile (ArrayList<T> a, Predicate<T> f) {
397    ArrayList<T> r = new ArrayList<>();
398    for (T e : a) if (f.test(e)) r.add(e); else break;
399    return r;
400  }
401
402  /**
403   * Creates an array from 'a'.
404   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
405   * @param a Array to convert.
406   * @return Ditto.
407   */
408  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
409  public static <T> T[] to (ArrayList<T> a) {
410    T[] r = (T[]) new Object[a.size()];
411    for (int i = 0; i < r.length; ++i) r[i] = a.get(i);
412    return r;
413  }
414
415  /**
416   * Creates an array from 'a'.
417   * @param a Array to convert.
418   * @return Ditto.
419   */
420  public static double[] toDoubles (ArrayList<Double> a) {
421    double[] r = new double[a.size()];
422    for (int i = 0; i < r.length; ++i) r[i] = a.get(i);
423    return r;
424  }
425
426  /**
427   * Creates an array from 'a'.
428   * @param a Array to convert.
429   * @return Ditto.
430   */
431  public static int[] toInts (ArrayList<Integer> a) {
432    int[] r = new int[a.size()];
433    for (int i = 0; i < r.length; ++i) r[i] = a.get(i);
434    return r;
435  }
436
437  /**
438   * Returns JSON representation of 'a'.
439   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
440   * @param a Array.
441   * @param eToJs Function to 'JSONize' elements of 'a'.
442   * @return JSON representation of 'a'.
443   */
444  public static <T> String toJs (ArrayList<T> a, Function<T, String> eToJs) {
445    return Js.w(map(a, eToJs));
446  }
447
448  /**
449   * Returns a representation of 'a'.
450   * @param <T> Type of 'a' elements.
451   * @param a Array
452   * @return A representation of 'a'.
453   */
454  public static <T> String toStr (ArrayList<T> a) {
455    return "[" +
456      Arr.join(
457        Arr.map(
458          a,
459          (e) -> e instanceof String
460            ? Str.quote((String)e)
461            : e.toString()
462        ), ", "
463      ) +
464      "]"
465    ;
466
467  }
468}
